braincomputer.mq package¶

Submodules¶

braincomputer.mq.mq module¶

class braincomputer.mq.mq.Mq(address)[source]¶

Bases: object

If you want to change the queue just change lines 13-15 to the new queue initialization. Make sure the queue implements the methods: 1. create_queue - set up parameters, connect, anything that needs to be done before we can send/recieve from the queue 2. consume_from_queue 3. send_to_queue 4. close queue Also - all functions use *args so it’s easy to replace to a queue that has different arguments for those methods

close_queue()[source]¶
consume_from_queue(*args)[source]¶
create_queue(*args)[source]¶
send_to_queue(*args)[source]¶

braincomputer.mq.rabbitmq module¶

class braincomputer.mq.rabbitmq.Rabbitmq(host, port)[source]¶

Bases: object

close_queue()[source]¶
consume_from_queue(name, callback, key='')[source]¶

consume can be fanout if key is empty, or for the parsers topic queue -by routing key

create_queue(name, type)[source]¶

creates queue with a name and the type is fanout / topic

send_to_queue(body, name='queue', key='')[source]¶

publish to queue by name and key. default name -‘queue’ is for the server that gets the publish function
